page.title: 10HOUSING
page.content: The village of Necton had its original roots in Mill Street,where the mill was situated and the remains still are,and Church Street. Apart from the buildings in these two main streets random housing,often made of "clay lump" with reed roofs, straddled lanes leading to and from the village. Building radiated out from here, the greatest development coming after the second World War when council housing was erected along the Hale Road and to the North in Ketts Hill. Over the past 20 years mainly small developments and self built houses have sprung up consisting in the main of bungalows interspersed by a few houses and chalet bungalows. The village is one of five which has been designated as a development area over the next 10 years therefore new housing will continue to be built.
